examples: If you don’t act soon, you will be in trouble.
I started acting at the age of eleven in my local theatre.

definitions.definition: Of a play: to be acted out (well or badly).
To behave in a certain manner for an indefinite length of time.
examples: A dog which acts aggressively is likely to bite.
I believe that Bill’s stuck-up because of the way that he acts .
He’s acting strangely—I think there’s something wrong with him.

definitions.definition: To convey an appearance of being.
examples: He acted unconcerned so the others wouldn’t worry.

definitions.definition: To do something that causes a change binding on the doer.

examples: High-pressure oxygen acts on the central nervous system and may cause convulsions or death.
Gravitational force acts on heavy bodies.
definitions.label_groups: intransitive , construed with on or upon

examples: He’s been acting Shakespearean leads since he was twelve.
He acted the angry parent, but was secretly amused.

definitions.definition: To carry out work as a legal representative in relation to a particular legal matter .
examples: A lawyer cannot act until they have been formally instructed by their client.

definitions.definition: To possess an action onto (some other structure). Examples include the group action of a group on a set , the action of a ring on a module by scalar multiplication , and the action of a group or algebra on a vector space via a representation .
examples: This group acts on the circle, so it can't be left-orderable!
definitions.label_groups: intransitive , mathematics , construed with on or upon , of an algebraic structure

definitions.definition: To move to action; to actuate; to animate.

secondary_definitions: ( obsolete , transitive ) To do (something); to perform.
( intransitive ) To perform a theatrical role.
( intransitive ) Of a play: to be acted out (well or badly).
( intransitive ) To behave in a certain manner for an indefinite length of time.
( copulative ) To convey an appearance of being.
( intransitive ) To do something that causes a change binding on the doer.
( intransitive , construed with on or upon ) To have an effect (on).
( intransitive , law ) To carry out work as a legal representative in relation to a particular legal matter .

( intransitive , mathematics , construed with on or upon , of an algebraic structure ) To possess an action onto (some other structure). Examples include the group action of a group on a set , the action of a ring on a module by scalar multiplication , and the action of a group or algebra on a vector space via a representation .
( obsolete , transitive ) To move to action; to actuate; to animate.
( obsolete , Scotland , transitive ) To enact ; to decree .
